member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.init
member.summary: Engine calls this function on editor initialization. Similar to the editor script's init() function.
member.returns: 1 if the editor is initialized successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.shutdown
member.summary: Engine calls this function on editor shutdown. Similar to the editor script's shutdown() function.
member.returns: 1 if the editor shutdown is performed successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.update
member.summary: Engine calls this function before updating each render frame when editor is loaded. Similar to the editor script's update() function.
member.returns: 1 if there were no errors during the editor update; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.postUpdate
member.summary: Engine calls this function after updating each render frame when editor is loaded. Similar to the editor script's postUpdate() function.
member.returns: 1 if there were no errors during the editor post update; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.render(EngineWindowPtr)
member.summary: Engine calls this function before rendering each render frame for the specified Engine window, when editor is loaded. Similar to the editor script's render() function.
member.returns: 1 if there were no errors during the editor rendering; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.worldInit
member.summary: Engine calls this function on world initialization when editor is loaded. This function is similar to the editor script's worldInit() function.
member.returns: 1 if there were no errors during the world initialization; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.worldShutdown
member.summary: Engine calls this function on world shutdown when editor is loaded. Similar to the editor script's worldShutdown() function.
member.returns: 1 if there were no errors during the world shutdown; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.worldSave
member.summary: Engine calls this function on world save when editor is loaded. Similar to the editor script's worldSave() function.
member.returns: 1 if there were no errors during the world saving; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.clear
member.summary: A callback on world reloading and clearing nodes list.

member.summary: Callback called on node reparenting.
member.param: A smart pointer to the node.

member.summary: Callback called on node reordering.
member.param: A smart pointer to the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.nodeRenamed(NodePtr,char)
member.summary: Callback called on node renaming.
member.param: A smart pointer to the node.
Old name of the renamed node.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.nodeShowInEditorChanged(NodePtr)
member.summary: Callback called on changing displaying in world hierarchy option for a node.

member.summary: Callback called on adding a material.

member.summary: Callback called on adding a property.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.materialCompileShadersBegin
member.summary: Callback called on launching shader compilation process.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.materialCompileShadersEnd
member.summary: Callback called on completion of shader compilation process.

member.name: M:Unigine.EditorLogic.materialCompileShaders(MaterialPtr,int)
member.summary: Callback called on completion of shader compilation process.
member.param: Current material for which shaders are compiled.
Number of remaining remaining materials for which shaders are to be compiled.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemLogic.init
member.summary: Engine calls this function on engine initialization. Similar to the system script's init() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemLogic.shutdown
member.summary: Engine calls this function on engine shutdown. Similar to the system script's shutdown() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemLogic.update
member.summary: Engine calls this function before updating each render frame. Similar to the system script's update() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemLogic.postUpdate
member.summary: Engine calls this function before rendering each render frame. Similar to the system script's postUpdate() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.init
member.summary: Engine calls this function on world initialization and initializes resources for a world scene during the world start. Similar to the world script's init() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.shutdown
member.summary: Engine calls this function on world shutdown. Here you can delete resources that were created during world script execution to avoid memory leaks. Similar to the world script's shutdown() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.update
member.summary: Engine calls this function before updating each render frame. You can specify here all logic-related functions you want to be called every frame while your application executes. Similar to the world script's update() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.updateSyncThread(int,int)
member.summary: Engine calls this function before the update() and the postUpdate(). Limitations: you should not create or modify nodes unless you're absolutely sure that no other thread can do the same. This function is called size times each frame and executed in parallel threads. Each time the function is called with an index in the range [0; size), i.e.: 0, 1, ..., size-1. This function blocks the Main Thread until all size calls are completed. Unlike the SyncThread() this function has got less time for execution, but it is more secure and is suitable for complex calculations to be applied to the current node.
member.param: Index of the current thread, that called this function in the [0; size) range.

Number of threads for execution. The function is called size times each frame and executed in parallel threads. Each time the function is called with an index in the range [0; size), i.e.: 0, 1, ..., size-1.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.updateAsyncThread(int,int)
member.summary: Engine calls this function before the execution of all updateSyncThread() functions. Like the updateSyncThread() it is called size times each frame and executed in parallel with user's postUpdate() and updatePhysics() functions, but does not block the Main Thread until the Engine reaches the doSwap() stage (similar to the updatePhysics() function). This function is the smoothest and does not cause spikes, it has a lot of time for execution. But it also has a lot of limitations. It is suitable for certain heavy resource-consuming calculations calculations that should be performed each frame, such as pathfinding, generation of procedural textures, and so on.
member.param: Index of the current thread, that called this function in the [0; size) range.

Number of threads for execution. The function is called size times each frame and executed in parallel threads. Each time the function is called with an index in the range [0; size), i.e.: 0, 1, ..., size-1.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.postUpdate
member.summary: Engine calls this function before rendering each render frame. You can correct behavior after the state of the node has been updated. Similar to the world script's postUpdate() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.updatePhysics
member.summary: Engine calls this function before updating each physics frame. This function is used to control physics in your application. The engine calls updatePhysics() with the fixed rate (60 times per second by default) regardless of the fps number. Similar to the world script's updatePhysics() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.swap
member.summary: Engine calls this function after the following processes are completed: rendering (CPU portion), physics calculations and pathfinding, GUI rendering, and all Async threads. The function is designed to operate with the results of the updateAsyncThread() method â€” all other methods (threads) have already been performed and are idle. After this function, only two actions occur: All objects that are queued for deletion are deleted. Profiler is updated. This function is similar to the world script's swap() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.save(StreamPtr)
member.summary: Engine calls this function when the world is saving its state. Here you can save custom user data to a file. Similar to the world script's save() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldLogic.restore(StreamPtr)
member.summary: Engine calls this function when the world is restoring its state. Restore custom user data to a file here. Similar to the world script's restore() function.
member.returns: Returns 1 if there were no errors; otherwise, 0.
